definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: The second American feminist movement began in the 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 第二次美国妇女运动始于二十世纪六十年代中期。

sentences.english: Therefore, they found it hard to join the Women's Movement in anger directed at men in general.
sentences.chinese: 因此，她们通常难以参加针对男人的妇女运动。

sentences.english: The fourth Part emphasizes the valuation of being in progress to anti-Japanese base area's Women's Movement.
sentences.chinese: 第四部分，着重对抗日根据地妇女运动进行评价。

sentences.english: Part one, emphasizes the background of Women's Movement in anti-Japanese base areas.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分，着重论述抗日根据地妇女运动兴起的背景。

sentences.english: Women's movement has not really penetrated here.
sentences.chinese: 妇女运动在这里还没有真正深入人心。

sentences.english: That's where the Women's Liberation Movement comes into play .
sentences.chinese: 那就是为什么会产生妇女运动。

sentences.english: At the same time, the enlightenments that come from women's liberation are also extremely profound.
sentences.chinese: 同时，中共妇女运动带给我们的启示也是极其深刻的。

definition: anti-imperialist movement of 30th May 1925, involving general strike esp. in Shanghai, Guangzhou, Hong Kong etc
democratic revolution/bourgeois revolution (in Marx-Leninist theory, a prelude to the proletarian revolution)
the Save the Nation Anti-Japanese Protest Movement stemming from the Manchurian railway incident of 18th July 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变
pinyin: Kang4 Ri4 Jiu4 wang2 Yun4 dong4

definition: May Fourth Movement/Chinese national renewal movement that started with 4th May 1919 protest against the Treaty of Versailles
the New Culture Movement (mid-1910s and 1920s), intellectual revolution against Confucianism aiming to introduce Western elements, especially democracy and science
bourgeois revolution (in Marx-Leninist theory, a prelude to the proletarian revolution)
pinyin: zi1 chan3 jie1 ji2 ge2 ming4
